bullets.text: Fed sets 2026 pricing for Reserve Bank payment services; banks face updated fees from January 1, 2026.
Supreme Court allows Texas to use GOP-friendly maps, likely boosting Republicans’ House prospects in 2026.
U.S. layoff announcements hit 1.1 million YTD, highest since 2020, signaling softer labor demand.
Meta reportedly cutting metaverse budget up to 30%, reallocating spend to AI; shares rise on efficiency push.
Nvidia’s cash hoard swells, raising prospects for larger buybacks, dividends or strategic investments.
SoFi to raise $1.5 billion via stock offering; shares fall on dilution concerns.
Microsoft will raise prices for commercial Office subscriptions in July, underscoring durable software pricing power.
Anthropic inks $200 million deal to bring its LLMs to Snowflake customers, accelerating enterprise AI adoption.
Legal AI startup Harvey confirms $8 billion valuation, highlighting investor appetite for AI-enabled professional services.
Amazon reportedly exploring dropping USPS to build competing postal service, threatening incumbents and reshaping last-mile costs.
Macron urges China’s Xi to help end Russia’s war in Ukraine, pressing Beijing’s leverage over Moscow.
Antarctic ozone hole among smallest in decades, reflecting continued benefits of Montreal Protocol controls.
3.3-billion-year-old crystals reveal surprisingly active early Earth, informing models of ancient tectonics and crust formation.
New optics breakthrough promises sharper astronomical imaging, potentially transforming telescopes and deep-space observations.
Netflix says AV1 now powers 30% of streaming, improving compression efficiency and reducing bandwidth costs.
